programme.title: Brussels, My Love?
programme.desc: From the economy to the climate and the EU's role in world affairs, this talk show sheds light on European affairs and the issues that impact on our daily lives as Europeans.

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: (1989) Matthew Broderick, Denzel Washington and Morgan Freeman star in Edward Zwick's epic, Oscar-winning tribute to the first Black regiment raised in the North during the Civil War.

programme.title: And Then We Danced
programme.desc: (2019) Passionate romantic drama with real-life dancer Levan Gelbakhiani. Two male dancers must keep their relationship a secret in the macho world of Georgian dancing. In Georgian/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: (1947) WWII drama. James Cagney stars as the tough US secret agent overseeing a special mission to discover the location of the factory where the Nazis are manufacturing their flying bombs.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: (2015) Comedy starring Mark Wahlberg, Will Ferrell and Linda Cardellini. A man's living happily with his wife and stepchildren - until the kids' biological dad swaggers back onto the scene.

programme.title: Stillwater
programme.desc: (2021) Tom McCarthy's crime thriller starring Matt Damon as an all-American, still-waters-run-deep oil worker from Oklahoma who travels to Marseilles to try to get his daughter out of jail.

programme.title: Not Okay
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly comic social media satire. Wannabe influencer Danni Sanders (Zoey Deutsch) creates a fake Insta-life, but her lies spiral out of control in the real world. With Dylan O'Brien.

programme.title: Second Coming
programme.desc: (2014) Drama starring Nadine Marshall, Idris Elba and Kai Francis Lewis as a family whose lives become complicated and fraught after a seemingly miraculous marital event occurs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Time Lock
programme.desc: (1957) Gripping drama with Robert Beatty. An expert team races against the clock to save a six-year-old boy who's been trapped in a seemingly impregnable bank vault.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: (1948) Historical adventure. A man (Louis Hayward) returns from the Wars of the Roses to learn from his uncle that a family friend has killed his father. But is everything as it seems?

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: (1992) High-stakes courtroom drama with more than a few good actors, including Jack Nicholson, Demi Moore and Tom Cruise. Can a lackadaisical naval lawyer crack a battle-hardened colonel?

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: (2018) World War II horror produced by JJ Abrams, with Jovan Adepo. American soldiers parachute into occupied France, where they're confronted by the horrific results of Nazi experiments.

programme.title: I Am Not a Witch
programme.desc: (2017) Rungano Nyoni's BAFTA Film Award-winning satirical drama. In a rural Zambian village, a quiet, serious-looking girl is accused of witchcraft. In Nyanja/Bemba/Tonga/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: (1958) Romantic thriller. George Baker stars as a heroic Cavalier horseman, beating off the Roundhead foe as he single-handedly smuggles the country's aristocracy to safety in France.

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: (1961) World War II comedy starring Jack Lemmon. A luckless naval lieutenant is duped into commanding a dangerous mission into enemy territory during the Battle of the Bismarck Sea.

programme.title: Dog
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?

programme.title: Deja Vu
programme.desc: (2006) Pulsating sci-fi action with Denzel Washington and Val Kilmer. An AFT agent uses new technology to reach back in time, stop a ferry bombing, and save the love of his life. Simple.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.
(2023) Sci-fi action adventure starring Adam Driver as a spaceman who crash-lands on a strange planet where giant lizards stalk the darkness... 65 million years ago. Where on Earth is he?

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: (1989) Matthew Broderick, Denzel Washington and Morgan Freeman star in Edward Zwick's epic, Oscar-winning tribute to the first Black regiment raised in the North during the Civil War.

programme.title: And Then We Danced

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: Daddy's Home
